title: Temperature Controlled Storage & Distribution Logs
description: Requirements for temperature control documentation including temperature monitoring logs, cold chain management, equipment calibration, alarm systems, and corrective action records for temperature deviations

requirements.question: Are there records of final product temperature checks for temperature sensitive product?
Are there temperature logs for the production area (if refrigerated)?
Are there temperature logs for storage rooms?
Is there a documented procedure for checking truck trailer temperature and reviewing sanitary condition of truck trailers prior to loading?

Are there records of shipping truck trailer (or other transportation systems) temperature checks, indicating the truck trailer temperature settings and that the truck trailer was pre-cooled prior to loading?
Are there sanitary condition logs for shipping truck trailers (or other transportation systems)?

capaInject: Implement immediate corrective actions when product temperatures exceed specified limits including evaluation for disposition or destruction
Establish procedures for addressing refrigerated storage area temperature deviations including equipment service and product safety assessment
Develop action plans when truck trailers arrive without proper pre-cooling including rejection criteria and carrier notification
Create preventive measures for temperature monitoring equipment including calibration schedules and alarm system verification testing
Implement verification procedures to ensure truck sanitation issues are corrected before loading and carriers maintain hygiene standards
traceabilityInject: Maintain final product temperature check records for all temperature-sensitive products with time stamps and corrective actions when out of range
Keep refrigerated production area temperature logs documenting continuous monitoring or periodic checks with alarm event records
Retain storage room temperature logs showing compliance with specified ranges including automated system data and manual verification
Document truck trailer temperature verification procedures including pre-cooling confirmation, set point verification, and loading protocols
Archive truck sanitary condition inspection logs noting cleanliness, odors, structural integrity, and rejection documentation when applicable
micro_inject: Temperature abuse above 41Â°F allows rapid multiplication of Listeria monocytogenes in ready-to-eat refrigerated products during storage
Inadequate refrigeration permits growth of psychrotrophic pathogens including Yersinia enterocolitica and non-proteolytic Clostridium botulinum
Warm truck trailers allow mesophilic pathogens like Salmonella and E. coli to proliferate rapidly during transportation to distribution
Temperature fluctuations during storage create condensation promoting microbial growth and cross-contamination from environmental sources
Unsanitary truck conditions introduce extraneous contamination including fecal material harboring enteric pathogens onto packaged products
